website_summaries.verdict: A great mirrorless Panasonic digital camera that is small enough to fit in a pocket for street photography.
pros: 1-inch sensor minimizes the profile and design of the camera for easy transport
Electronic viewfinder is easy to navigate and use

customer_reviews.title: A cautionary note
customer_reviews.text: After reading many online reviews, we selected this camera as a replacement for our aging (and heavy) Nikon D90. When we were setting up the camera, we encountered a few problems that had nothing at all to do with the camera itself. I'm a senior citizen, and even with eyeglasses, I was unable to read the instruction manual or the tiny print on the camera screens itself. In the end, we couldn't set it up nor take a single image. We were so disappointed and had to return the camera. So, folks, if you have any issues at all with reading small type, this camera might not be the best for you.
customer_reviews.author: adwhiz

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This camera is junk DO NOT BUY. Took the camera on trip to a remote part of Nepal. Failed halfway through the trip. Failure mode is that the camera would get in some sort of infinite loop and the touch screen display would endlessly loop thought nonsense screens. Also failed so will only focus on a tiny section in the lower left of the field of view. Due to weight constraints had only one camera -- I'm furious as I was counting on this camera for capturing photos of a once in a lifetime trip.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Dancing

customer_reviews.title: complicated but good camera, especially for the zoom.
customer_reviews.text: I have a top of the line Nikon professional camera. I wanted something light weight with a great zoom, image stabilization and low light capability. This camera provides all this in one little complex box. This camera has more features then you will ever use! Unfortunately, it is complicated and if you do not use it all the time, you forget all the controls which could be problem if your fingers accidentally hit a button and it messes up the settings.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Love this little camera!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional photographer and I ordered this as a travel camera because I don't want to be carrying my big DSLR everywhere on vacation. It's nice and small and light, and takes GREAT pictures. Picture quality is very important to me, and the pictures are rich in color and sharp. The camera has a lot of great functions including 4K video, and you can choose to shoot fully automatic or put it into manual mode. Easy to use, great photos! Can highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Martina Hough

customer_reviews.title: Not the Camera for me.
customer_reviews.text: Returned this camera after a few days. Ultimately for me....it along with he Sony 100 naturally soften the picture too much for my taste. I ultimatwly went with the Canon G7X MKii. I was far more please with the results from the canon. They are all 3 nearly the same size....can easily drop them in my cargo pant pockets.... As usually with all cameras....you really need to get one or find a place like Best Buy that has them on Display to try out and see which works best for you. Thos did not work for me. The Fuji camera.....it was really expensive...but took great pictures....and loved that the major adjustments were on simple rotary knobs for access.
customer_reviews.author: Camhannally

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent travel camera
customer_reviews.text: I had a recent trip to London, and did not want to cary around my much bigger FZ1000. I picked up this one as more of a travel camera, and because it also has a 1" sensor. It's not as good as the FZ1000, but is usually good enough to get the job done. It worked well for me on the trip, as long as I set everything manually. Picture quality is pretty good, and it has good low light performance. I've also had good luck taking pictures with this at concerts. It's definitely better than a typical point and shoot, but not as good as a full size camera.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: If you can only take one camera with you...
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding one size fits all travel camera with a high res 1" sensor. The EVF makes those long zoom photos steady and when in silent mode makes stealth photos possible. The customizable lens ring makes a number of functions (i.e., EV, ISO, WB, zoom, etc.) easy to use quickly. It feels good in your hands and even fits in cargo pants pockets or jacket pockets with ease. You could get that new Sony, but the Sony doesn't zoom as far and the price difference is well...
customer_reviews.author: Old.Movies@Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Needs one important feature
customer_reviews.text: The features of this camera are all you could ever need. I highly recommend it as a world travel camera. It is not about having a big expensive camera. It is all about having a lightweight compact camera that you can have with you at all times. The one thing this camera needs most is ; more texture on the body of the camera. it is too smooth and slippery ! I put squares and rectangles of grip tape on the portions of the camera your fingers touch while using it. The basic, in camera, RAW processing feature is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Proximo

customer_reviews.title: A big camera in a small package
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to upgrade from a pocket camera, originally I bought a Sony a6000, which I liked with the exception of the overheating problem while shooting video. But after a while, I found myself leaving it at home because I didn’t want to have to lug around a case with the camera and extra equipment. I wanted to go back to a pocket camera, but one with the quality and features of a full size camera. This gets me 95% of the way there. It's perfect for what I want. Much better than a phone, or small pocket camera, yet much easier to carry around than a full camera set.
customer_reviews.author: R. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera; produces outstanding low light pix.
customer_reviews.text: Briefly, this is an excellent camera and will produce pictures that are clear with all colors rendered properly. The only drawbacks are: 1. Bulk. This isn't a camera you can slip into a shirt pocket. 2. Complexity. The camera has an automatic mode, which translates into point and shoot. However, if you want outstanding photos, especially in low light, you'll have to spend a good deal of time with the manual and the camera, as the controls are a long way from being intuitive. 3. Price. At the normal retail price, this isn't a terrifically good buy. I bought mine at a heavily discounted price, which made it a good value for the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: W.L. Emery

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, Fun and Excellent Picture Quality
customer_reviews.text: ZS200 is an amazing camera love the size, image image quality and zoom. I always carry itwith me so I never miss the Perfect picture. I highly recommend this camera. I’ve taken some amazing wildlife and landscape pictures. This is a camera you can really have fun with...no changing lenses, no lugging heavy DSLR around, just put this in your pocket and go take quality pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Mckinney

customer_reviews.title: Terrific little camera
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure at first. Read reviews,"soft lens at corners", etc.. Got one anyway and happy I did. The Picture quality, ease of use, versatile lens range...this camera has it all. And, the digital zoom feature takes it to 500mm and looks good. The ZS100 has most of the features that I use on my Nikon D600 and I find myself reaching for the ZS more often.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Corley

customer_reviews.title: Good but complex and misleading on "burst photos" which are not photos at all.
customer_reviews.text: Has a lot of functions its predecessors did not have so might be challenging for a real simple "point and shooter", But has eye view which I view as crucial as sometimes the screen simply can't be seen in full daylight. You may also need extra batteries if used heavily. The 4K Photo burst is totally misleading, it creates a video NOT multiple JPEG photos so you have find some way to grab a frame using third party software, then turn into a JPEG, then rename so it fits back in the series. For this reason it gets one star only. Lens quality is good. I would not buy again due to misinformation on the "burst" function.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Confusing settings and not appreciable upgrade from high-end smartphones
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to sit somewhere between my Android Pixel phone and my DSLR. Have to say it's not really much better than my smartphone and the controls are fairly poor. For instance, autofocus is either instant (and poor) or lengthy shot selection -- doesn't appear to be much in between. Autosharpening is always extreme, even on lower settings, forcing you to use RAW files. Video stabilization is years behind iPhones and Android phones. Picture quality is generally OK, but not outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Garbanzo

customer_reviews.title: A lot of fun
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking at this camera for a couple of years. The price finally dropped and I'm glad I snatched one up. The build is very solid and I love that it fits in a LOOSE fitting pants pocket and easily in a cargo or jacket pocket. The image quality is much better than I thought it would be especially with the weaker aperture at the long end. The auto focus is quick and accurate. I thought I would hate that the screen doesn't tilt but I got used to it pretty quick and don't even think about it anymore. Not into video so I can't comment on the 4k quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Slippery camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera but was disappointed with the auto focus speed. Once focused it is spot on however. It's great in low light and the ISO choices are many. The zoom is adequet but wish it were 15x like my panny fr1000. The camera is very slippery and hard to hold so l bought an aftermarket adapter for the grip and thumb rest and now it feels very secure in my hand. This can be purchased online a a very affordable price. Overall a very nice camera and images are very good.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Vosseler

customer_reviews.title: Interimttent operation
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure yet what the problem is... Sometimes it just quits. Shake it or thump it a little sometimes helps. Turning it off and on sometimes helps. I wish it would just do anything consistently. This camera could be very complicated to get the most out of it. It's got a lot of extra settings that I have no idea what they do. I opted for "full automatic", let the camera worry about it. The pictures it takes (not me) are very good - better than expected. But for the $$$ it should work all the time...
customer_reviews.author: A. Croisant

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have a printed quick start manual but the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well in low light with a 1 inch sensor. Nice to have a printed quick start manual but the more advanced manual is over 300 pages- not practical to print. For the price should have included a charger and AV cable. Lots of settings that probably wouldn't use but very compact for travel and a good 15X optical zoom.
customer_reviews.author: G. T. Spigel

customer_reviews.title: One Noticeable Issue - Photos Seem Washed Out
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera and took it on a trip to Alaska in July 2019. The camera works well and is solid and durable. I'm not a camera afficionado so I do not use many of the advanced settings. I took most photos outside with the intelligent automatic setting. The camera focuses quickly and generally works well, but the photos all seemed washed out. I had to darken the photos with software to bring out important details in them. Is there a fix for the washed out issue?
customer_reviews.author: E. Clinton

customer_reviews.title: Camera stopped working after 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: My camera was purchased on Feb. 15, 2018, today is June 27, 2018. My screen stopped working. This is very sad considering the cost of the camera and all the extras came to: $ 688.79. Now we will see if they stay behind their product. Wish me luck...... got a feeling I will need it. I just called the help line. The site had stated it was open until 8:00 pm. It is now 5:27 pm and the recording told me it was closed. Like I said - wish me luck.
customer_reviews.author: michael karpie

customer_reviews.title: Great travel camera.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this two weeks now and really like it. This camera replaces an older TZ4 model from about 10 years ago. The ZS100 is a little larger but still a good travel camera size, especially considering the 1" sensor and 10X zoom range. Having the P, A, S and full Manual modes as well as the 2 iAE modes is super. The flash has good wide angle coverage.
customer_reviews.author: D. Miller

customer_reviews.title: All around good camera with one exception.
customer_reviews.text: I have been very satisfied with most everything about this camera. My only complaint is its inability to take a satisfactory picture with a bright background.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Seaman

customer_reviews.title: I have had this camera for a little over a ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this camera for a little over a year. I took it on two big trips, kept it in a case and have never mishandled it and now when I power the camera on it makes a loud grinding noise which is also carried over when zooming in and our recording video. Its really disappointing. I have always been a big advocate of Panasonic cameras... not any more. DO NOT BUY. Unless you have 600 to throw away on a camera that is basically disposable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great Pocket Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a little bigger than other pocket cameras but well worth the size and cost. The eye level viwer is great in bright sun where a live view screen is useless. Fits well in the hand. JPEG files are clean. Not over compressed or over sharpened. If you want even better quality there is also RAW available. It will not replace my Canon EOS 5DsR but for every day use this camera is hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Tom in Tubac

customer_reviews.title: My vacation shots are great
customer_reviews.text: Every 4-5 years I buy a new Pocket-able Camera. The technology gets better and the owners manuals get thicker (actually you get an 'overview' manual and the full one is a PDF). Works great and the battery is long lasting ( I do not shoot much video). My vacation shots are great and survive lots of Cropping and Tilting as I often have to do quick grab shots.
customer_reviews.author: Searover

customer_reviews.title: Dust is an issue
customer_reviews.text: Went to Africa recently and dust got inside. Apparently this is a problem with this camera. In the shop now probably will upgrade to the ZS 200 as the lens and labor are on me.
customer_reviews.author: GeoH

customer_reviews.title: Great Point & Shoot Camera ... Nice DSLR Backup
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for in a point & shoot camera to carry around when I choose not to take my large and some what heavy DSLR camera. This camera has a lot of DLSR features that most photographers use. The functionality and image quality is excellent ... from an enthusiast perspective plus I saved a lot of money not going with the major name brands like Nikon, Cannon or Sony Looks like Panasonic is a major player and competitor in the digital camera market.
customer_reviews.author: James L. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Not that good
customer_reviews.text: The quality of pictures with high zoom are not that good which is the most important feature of this camera, the "Turn 4K Into Photography" is not usable, only usable if you want take pictures of your dog in sunny day otherwise photos produced is not usable at all.
customer_reviews.author: M. Noman

customer_reviews.title: Sophisticated small camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful small camera with lots of potential. It can also just be a simple point and shoot. It all depends on how you use the menu and settings! I got it mostly for the zoom possibilities but it seems to have lots of capability in other areas. The only downside is that it is slightly heavy but that is clearly the result of the big lens system.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Boyle

customer_reviews.title: A Camera I'd Like to Love But Can't!
customer_reviews.text: As a frequent traveller, I have been seeking a compact camera with good quality. The Lumix ZS200 seems to fit the bill. So I thought. First of all, the wifi connection has been very unstable for me. The battery that boasts 300 some shots on a full charge only gave me 79 shots before blinking red. On one occasion, the camera simply freezed with display screen still on. Switching the camera off won't even solve the problem. I had to remove the battery to turn it off. Never had so many issues with any camera within such short time. Already requested to return it. Sorry, I thought you were the one!
customer_reviews.author: WG186

customer_reviews.title: Could be a great travel camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera while it worked. Zoom was great and extended zoom was useful. Image quality was good and low light performance and manual controls also worked well. Unfortunately after a week of moderate testing it developed black blobs on the screen whenever I tried to focus and take a picture so I had to return it. Pity.
customer_reviews.author: cnam

customer_reviews.title: WiFi/Bluetooth function does not work
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and operation of this camera. What has been completely frustrating is that I can’t get the Bluetooth/WiFi to work so I am unable to transfer pictures to my iPhone or iPad. This is one of the features In which I was most interested. I just got back from a 2 week trip and finally reverted to using my iPhone camera because of this issue. The Lumix was useless. I have seen on the internet that others have had the same problem and have not been able to resolve it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful little camera.
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera. I bought it for non-photographer boyfriend and he adores it. I chose it for the 10x optical zoom not realizing it is also a very high-quality lens. The camera on full automatic is amazing smart, recognizing portraits vs landscapes vs macros and setting the focal length accordingly. Wow.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Bell

customer_reviews.title: It is the easiest to use camera I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I had an early Lumix, which I loved, but when it died, I ended up with an Olympus (which I really didn't like). Now that it is done, I'm back to Lumix, and this version is GREAT! It has a great zoom, I can get it going quickly for photos on the fly, and it auto focuses beautifully almost every time. The only thing I would be careful of is the strap. I purchased this camera before a vacation, and had the camera strap around my wrist every day. After about 10 days the strap broke and the camera fell! I would definitely get a more sturdy strap than the one that comes with it.
customer_reviews.author: JenB1964

customer_reviews.title: Macro and telephoto work great
customer_reviews.text: So far after a months use I am very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: An Impressive Point and Shoot Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Panasonic camera and I am very impressive with the ease of use as well as the quality of the images. I just returned from a three week trip during which I tested my new camera in a variety of daylight and night time settings and was able to create terrific images repeatedly. I would recommend the Lumix ZS100 for anyone seeking a powerful point and shoot camera.
customer_reviews.author: Lennie S.

customer_reviews.title: One fine camera
customer_reviews.text: Living up to my expectations. Takes sharp photos in almost any setting. Low light great. The 250 end is super to have but the 25 is not wide enough for some subjects. The image stabilization is superb. Can't beat size and features for travel.
customer_reviews.author: CasTrav

customer_reviews.title: Soft lens quality
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed by the lens quality. Once zoomed out past 100mm or so, diffraction seriously affects image quality. It makes images look soft, hazy. It can be sharpened up to a degree in post editing, but the lens should not be that soft to begin with. Except for the lens softness and an AF system that sometimes misses the target, this is a good travel zoom camera.
customer_reviews.author: mLo68

customer_reviews.title: Unusually compact with huge controls.
customer_reviews.text: Extraordinarily impress. I suggest the purchase of book, "Photographer's Guide to the Panasonic ZS100" (about $27). Some of the rather brilliant features are hard to find with the regular instructions (you have to know it is there to find it!), such as extracting a single frame from an MP4 movie for use as a single JPeg shot.
customer_reviews.author: Leah McL

customer_reviews.title: Great travel camera.
customer_reviews.text: Got this Camera based on stellar reviews on-line when looking for a quality travel camera. Takes great photos in the auto modes. Numerous times, however, when holding the camera my finger would touch the edge of the touchscreen and set the focus there by mistake.
customer_reviews.author: KSid

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck - by far!
customer_reviews.text: I adore this camera!! I use it as a point-and-shoot with zoom. It is even better than my Canon G9 was at night. I'm in love with it.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie A. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: zoom is not durable making the camera worthless
customer_reviews.text: zoom stopped working after 2 months now its worthless .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: This one of the more expensive point and shoot cameras and it is fairly complex in terms of its abilities. Lots of filters and effects. With some practice I gained familiarity and feel it was a good choice for me. Great zoom for a point and shoot and opportunity to use manual shutter and focal point. I feel it was a good purchase for an upcoming vacation where my regular Camera is too weighty and bulky
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen E. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Stunning photos and videos
customer_reviews.text: There's a learning curve (stabilizer, light balance, zoom) and something is draining the battery, but I carry a spare. Replaced my Cannon D-60 and fits in my pocket. Perfect camera for concerts, outdoor activities, and times when your phone will not capture the depth of field, low light, and subtle colors.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Very nice compact camera
customer_reviews.text: The camera is a great compact point and shoot. It is light weight and compact, great for hiking. I have been shooting mountain landscapes and wild flowers. I have only used the automatic setting, as i just got the camera. The pictures are crisp. It is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with this camera would give 10 star
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this camera would give 10 star
customer_reviews.author: Elson D. Santana

customer_reviews.title: Good for non specialized enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.text: Reasonable zoom, great macro, 1 inch sensor, means enthusiasts can get into all kind of photography, Street, some wildlife, portrait, etc... Not on a high quality apsc or full frame level, but much better than a phone or small sensor compact.
customer_reviews.author: dror

customer_reviews.title: Better than an iPhone but not ideal.
customer_reviews.text: This camera has too many extra features. The photo quality is fine but not amazing. It is just okay. Two problems that I have encountered is: short battery life and the hand strap broke the first time out. I do like the size of the camera.
customer_reviews.author: KRB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Takes great images and is a very compact size for travel. Pricey but I'd buy again.
customer_reviews.author: T. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Overall really pleased. Better battery life than I expected
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm really impressed with this camera, the only negative if I'm going to be nit-picky is a bit of softness in the center of focus at certain focal lengths. Overall really pleased. Better battery life than I expected, amazing video quality and rich vibrant stills.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Jay Priboy

customer_reviews.title: Camera for travel
customer_reviews.text: Perfect camera for travel, small and capable. Fits in a pocket. Easy to operate. I do not carry my SLR when traveling any more.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good photos
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for the size. Overall I think the photo quality is great. The camera feels a little cheap in the hand though. I feel like it can easily break, but no issues otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty

customer_reviews.title: The best travel camera ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best travel camera I've ever owned, and arguably the best that exists - period. It's small enough to put in a jacket pocket or belt case, so I have it with me always. The 25-250 mm equiv zoom lens covers almost everything I want to shoot, though it wouldn't be long enough for a safari. The 1 inch sensor means that picture quality is fine up to ISO 1600 or even 3200. It has all the special features of modern digital cameras, and it's reasonably fast on startup and shutdown. I got mine just in time for an extended trip to Europe,, and I've been using it constantly with great satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Bloomfield

customer_reviews.title: Used- when I paid for new.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my first camera and it came in a non-sealed box and it was obvious that the battery had been inserted before. I returned it and ordered a replacement. Second one shows up and it is the same story - opened before. I decided to risk it and kept the second. I have not used it extensively but it seems to work.
customer_reviews.author: a fan

customer_reviews.title: Great zoom. And view finder!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Panasonic Lumix cameras (my 4th one over the past years). The features are great. The zoom I especially am happy with, touch screen, 20 mg sensor and the focus refocus. I am shake-y so that is important in my choice. Also wanted the viewfinder. Am learning and enjoying this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Donna R. Rapose

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Item received in good time, well packaged. I’m just in the testing phase, bu so far I like the quality of pictures. Lens is excellent. Hard to believe size of lens in relation to size of camera, but I am very pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: Malt37

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: This will be my second Panasonic camera, Great investment, they have listen to the users. Looking for my next trip.
customer_reviews.author: MrRod

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best small point and shoot. It actually does just about everything my big DSLR does. It is my new favorite camera. Great night shots on pre-set. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great all purpose camera
customer_reviews.text: Very versatile camera. Great photos. Took it to a week long music festival. Great results both indoors and outdoors. Left the DSLRs and other cameras in the car. Indoor shots at ISO up to 3200 were quite usable. Took most photos in RAW format, but also had good results with 4KPhoto setting.
customer_reviews.author: CG_and Karen

customer_reviews.title: Not too keen of the picture quality
customer_reviews.text: While it is good all rounder camera, just can't get over the picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: So far we love this camera, we did a lot of research and this is the perfect size for travel. We didn't want a big bulky camera, easy to carry in purse, photos are great
customer_reviews.author: wildyellowrose

customer_reviews.title: Great Point-and-Shoot
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera at this price point. It has terrific zoom capabilities and the color reproduction is spot on. The image quality isn't quite as good as the Sony RX100, but if you want zoom, this is definitely the camera to go with.
customer_reviews.author: L. Moskowitz

customer_reviews.title: Customer service
customer_reviews.text: I am reviewing Cameta Camera. They did an outstanding job contacting me and answering my questions. Customer service and satisfaction are obviously very important to them.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful little camera
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful little camera, has a lot of functions, great photos, easy to use, small size can fit in your pocket. Nice buy.
customer_reviews.author: Linda D Rivard-Hilliker

customer_reviews.title: Long unpredictable shutter lag
customer_reviews.text: Shutter lag is a deal breaker. I'll be sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: but I now love it.
customer_reviews.text: A little trouble catching on to it. I am not too familiar with camera, but I now love it.
customer_reviews.author: Neeter4

customer_reviews.title: Zoom lens malfunction
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these camera model DC-ZS200 and DMC-TZ60 Both cameras having the same problems "System Error(Zoom) One of them is still under guarantee I am in England now Please advice where can I return for repairs
customer_reviews.author: San Jim

customer_reviews.title: My travel camera
customer_reviews.text: Great travel camera. Picture quality not as good as even Sony A6000. Crummy EVF but it has one!
customer_reviews.author: hedgehog

customer_reviews.title: Simple to Take Along; Difficult to Master
customer_reviews.text: The zoom is excellent. The menu is very complex, however, and I have to refer frequently to the online manual
customer_reviews.author: Zayde Seymour

customer_reviews.title: Looking forward to traveling with this camera
customer_reviews.text: Love the portability of 1 inch sensor cameras that manage very high picture quality...zoom range adds versatility on top of all that.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice
customer_reviews.text: I've used this on several trips and am happy with the results. I like that you can save the photos as RAW format too. I mostly use Auto mode but the manual options available are comparable with the Nikon D90.
customer_reviews.author: T. Durham

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp photos for a 1" sensor.
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp images! Others has had lens issues, mine is very good. The Electronic Viewfinder is small. But better than the other Panasonic travel ZS cameras
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Peach

customer_reviews.title: I bought the ZS200 and basically liked the way it worked
customer_reviews.text: I bought the ZS200 and basically liked the way it worked, BUT, it would lock up and I would have to reset to factory defaults. The only changes I made were to set on of the custom F "function" buttons to enable or disable the HDR feature, which it shows how to do in the owners manual. It worked fine for a while, then the HDR feature would not be available in any menu until I reset it. I called Panasonic and they were NO help, which is apparently a common complaint. Too bad because it is a nice camera and took great pictures when it was working Sony RX100 VI, here I come. :)
customer_reviews.author: dlg521

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like this camera, but there isn't a really stable way to hold it - like my bigger camera.
customer_reviews.author: Joan E. Sturm

customer_reviews.title: good camera. lots of options
customer_reviews.text: good camera. lots of options. good video. but as others also say ,a pain to use the wifi system on anything other than your cell phone. Quick focus and shutter so you will not lose the shot and shoots well in low light.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Small and capable - everything I need n a travel ...
customer_reviews.text: Small and capable - everything I need n a travel camera!
customer_reviews.author: Denalijay

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, like how the screen is interactive and you can focus with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Camera is in great shape, excellent quality. Photos are great - it's a little heavy, but can still fit into a large pocket, which is what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Carter

customer_reviews.title: A great travel companion
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a great combination of convenience and performance. The images are of high quality. The focus action is fast. And there are a lot of useful functions bundled in the small body. The only thing that I don't like is the limited aperture range.
customer_reviews.author: Klaus Yung-Jane Hsu

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It is a fantastic device. I wish I will sometime learn all its abilities to get everthing it can give
customer_reviews.author: Yossi Gonda

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves the look and feel of the camera! ...
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves the look and feel of the camera! So many options and modes to play with. You get a lot of camera for your money.
customer_reviews.author: J. Alvy

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera; Low Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: The product is a little heavy. The battery life is not great. But it takes great photos. The touch screen gets a little getting used to!t
customer_reviews.author: George Desmarais

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality... not any better than my iphone
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality photos... i phone takes better photos... tried to return but poor customer service from amazon. Will not let me return. Highly disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Sam Marshall

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE!  This camera has been a nightmare
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a mess! I deeply regret buying it. First, I attempted to erase a burst of photos when I accidentally set it on 4K mode and it deleted everything on the memory card wiping out two days of photography. After two more days, the camera broke completely and no longer powers on. Panasonic customer service is an oxymoron: rude and unhelpful. It’s extremely difficult to use and many of the photos are disappointing when viewed on a laptop or larger screen. Buy anything else or just use your smartphone.
customer_reviews.author: Lemiwinks

customer_reviews.title: Good camera if you want 15x zoom
customer_reviews.text: Very good images, color accuracy. Control interface took some getting use too. Best features - longest zoom in small portable digital camera, excellent low light capability. Less good features - image quality not as good as canon g7 mk 2. Canon interface more intuitive. Also more expensive than canon.
customer_reviews.author: Sci Fi Electronics man

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: For a compact camera its pretty good. Still working on the menu firmware.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Sen

customer_reviews.title: Great travel cam and sidekick to my XT2
customer_reviews.text: My brother has owned this camera since release and I got to use it during my trip to Japan and Hong Kong. Did it all great in a small package. Previously I owned the Sony RX100 mark I. Strong enthusiast point and and shoot. Lumix just gives me a bit more reach, great f2.8 lens, ibis, and touch screen. As a travel cam it does it all for me. It will be used on trips where I do not want to take my fujifilm XT2 setup that btw is superb. Would definitely recommend this Lumix zs100 to anyone looking for an almost all you can do small package camera that delivers great results.
customer_reviews.author: BellipotensTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little camera. Very good resolution for a long zoom.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: A Great Travel Camera
customer_reviews.text: A great little camera, a lot easier to pack around than My DSLR
customer_reviews.author: Scott R

customer_reviews.title: Great quality in small package
customer_reviews.text: It's worth the extra $ even though it may do more than you need
customer_reviews.author: Horst Stipp

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Camera - Reviews are right!
customer_reviews.text: Great Travel Camera. With its RAW format and access to Adobe Photoshop, I can achieve results similar to my Micro 4/3rds G3. This is a really solid camera with a good zoom range so I can pull of some great shots. I have expensive cameras that I never take with me. This is my "Take Everywhere" camera, and I'm getting by just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew A. Russell

customer_reviews.title: It was the better camera. The 4K picture feature is amazing
customer_reviews.text: I tried this camera against the Sony RX-100 VI. It was the better camera. The 4K picture feature is amazing. I have used it several times already to get great shots. Also, the post shot focus is very useful. I have shot several stills for products and am able to fine tune the focal point. The video feature is good not great. The only feature I wish it had was a higher frame rate video to do ultra slow motion video. This camera also has an amazing zoom. The Sony was not even close. It is small enough for travel. While I can't fit it into my pocket, I purchases a leather case that fits on my belt.
customer_reviews.author: PMcG

customer_reviews.title: but the impression so far is GREAT!. Amazing features and has a solid quality ...
customer_reviews.text: Have only had it one day, but the impression so far is GREAT!. Amazing features and has a solid quality feel. Initial pictures are great.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R. Penfield, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing photos
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera, great photos and video. I do have a slight problem that when I turn on the camera the lense cover that is supposed to retract gets stuck halfway open about 25% of the time. Not a big deal for me, but worth noting.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota Averill

customer_reviews.title: Photos on raw took too long
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a hiking trip through Spain. I wanted to shoot raw so that I could have options for manipulating photos. It would take very long too shot on raw. I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi B

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera but it is going to take me ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera but it is going to take me a while to learn all the capabilities. When I tried it at a store I wasn't quite convinced just because it felt slippery in my hands so I ordered a Flipbac FBG3. However, I found that using a neck strap was a much better idea and I am not using the Flipbac.
customer_reviews.author: Ziweth

customer_reviews.title: Great allaround camera to have with you at all times
customer_reviews.text: Great allaround camera to have with you at all times. For portraits I recommend setting to 70mm or longer to get some blur to background.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Pearson

customer_reviews.title: What is with the pricing!
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera. Too bad I bought it last week, and paid $100 more than it is going for today. Do I have any recourse?
customer_reviews.author: Carped8ta

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic camera with 1" matrix
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic camera with 1" matrix, LEICA optics and 10x zoom let you take photos of perfect quality easily. It has a lot of functionality when you need and is fully automated (very clever though) mode if you just want "point and shot". I think it the best compact camera at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: My first impressions of the ZS-100
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for 2 reasons: 1 inch sensor and the view finder for when its bright sun and I cant see the screen. I have had the camera for a fee days and so far its been great. I have owned other Panasonic cameras and never had a bad experience with any of them.
customer_reviews.author: David G Hayner

product_meta.title: PANASONIC LUMIX ZS100 4K Point and Shoot Camera, 10X LEICA DC Vario-ELMARIT F2.8-5.9 Lens with Hybrid O.I.S., 20.1 Megapixels, 1 Inch High Sensitivity Sensor, 3 Inch LCD, DMC-ZS100S (USA SILVER)
product_meta.description: Style:ZS100SPANASONIC LUMIX digital cameras are full of innovation for both traditional and modern camera enthusiasts. The LUMIX ZS100 brings together the visual performance of a large 1" sensor and the legendary optical performance of a bright LEICA DC Lens in a highly compact point-and-shoot camera. Traditionalists will love the hands-on manual feel of a lens-mounted control ring and thumbwheel, plus the familiarity of an eye-level electronic viewfinder. The modern enthusiast will love the Wi-Fi mobile device controllability and next-generation flexibility that 4K video and 4K PHOTO modes bring to the creative experience.
feature_bullets: Large 1, 20 Megapixel sensor delivers brighter, more colorful photos with fewer image artifacts
10x (25-250mm) LEICA DC Lens optical zoom performance with a wide F/2.8-5.9 aperture for impressive background defocus effects
4K Ultra HD video recording plus exclusive LUMIX 4K PHOTO and 4K Post Focus photo capture features

Eye-level Electronic Viewfinder (EVF) and touch-enabled LCD for a wider viewing experience. Focusing Area- Normal- Wide 50 cm - infinity / Tele 70 cm - infinity. Focusing Area- AF Macro / MF / Intelligent Auto / Motion Picture: Wide 5 cm - infinity / Tele 70 cm - infinity
Lens-mounted control ring brings DSLR-like exposure control to a compact point-and-shoot camera body

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars363 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
